title: From Delhi street child to acclaimed photographer: Vicky Roy – in pictures
text: A family living on the streets in New Delhi, in July 2018. Roy initially approached them to take photographs for a project for Save the Children. After a friend saw one he had posted on social media and offered to buy it, he went back to the family and asked how they might be able to help them improve their circumstances. The family said they were from Rajasthan and would like to open a small shop there so Roy and his friend raised the funds through his photographs to pay for a new start in their home town
description: Seeking out India’s most marginalised children as his subjects, Vicky Roy reflects the poverty, danger – and freedom – of his own childhood
